result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jay T. White Jr.

defendant.name: White, Jay T., Jr.
defendant.address: 5497 Wej Mo Gek Court, Crandon, WI 54520

records.addlTxt: Requesting bail bond reduction- 1 letter for CC Hatfield and 1 for Judge Stenz
Bail/bond hearing on November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Requesting bail bond reduction.2 letters for CC Deb Hatfield and 2 letters for Judge Stenz
Request for bond reduction. One letter for Court Commissioner and one for Judge Stenz.
No contact with Rhonda Rachal. No consumption of alcohol.

10:59 AM Defendant Jay T. White Jr. appeared by video, in custody from FC jail.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court received report from SPD, no attorney appointed to the case, will adjourn to another date and continues bond. White has contacted SPD daily and asks for bond reduction, he could possibly come up with $2500 cash. Court reviews bond. State makes statement regarding open cases. State does not object to reducing to $2500 cash with same conditions. Court reduces bond to $2500 cash, no contact with Rhonda Rachal. No consumption of alcohol. State and the court remind Mr. White of the no contact and explain the consequences of contacting the victim. White understands.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No contact with Rhonda Rachal. No consumption of alcohol

10:17 AM State of Wisconsin appears by Alex Seifert in person. Defendant in custody by Zoom. Defendant- contacted public defender. Still trying to find one. Prepared statement from victim. Ct- Breanna Halyburton advised last hearing that SPD is looking. Ct- no report form SPD. asking for bond reduction. Defendant- boss saying position at job is still available. also has opportunity to enroll back into treatment and classes. Needs help with bills and child care. Ct- No contact. Victim cannot drop no contact, ct does. states charges. State- based upon severity of charges and other. $5,000 cash bond is appropriate without further information. Defendant- Can post $1,000 today. victim Rhonda Rachal. Ct- Bond set $3,000. No consumption of alcohol, no contact still in place with victim  10/12/22 9:45
for bond reduction hearing.     Hearing is scheduled for 9/28/22.
Bail/bond hearing on September 28, 2022 at 10:45 am.

9:51 AM Defendant Jay T. White Jr. appeared by video, in custody from FC jail.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court will have the state provide a copy to him at the jail. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant understands. Court puts on the record that Attorney Halyburton has made the court aware that he is eligible for SPD, however she has a conflict and their office is looking for outside counsel to represent him in this matter. Court will have set for AIA and continues bond at this point. White makes statement as he believes the victim was going to be present at this hearing today, has employment opportunity, has had contact with his counselor - offering to do family counseling, has contacted SPD several times and asks for signature bond and to allow contact with mother of child for arrangements to be made for child visitation. Court denies request for signature bond and would not allow contact with victim, unless heard from the victim. Court asks Seifert to explain the process of waiving the no contact provision. Seifert explains process for victim to waive the no contact provision.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 10:45 am.
No contact with Rhonda Rachal. No consumption of alcohol
